unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify constitutional law principles within cases.
Apply constitutional law to new fact problems.
Assess different theories of constitutional interpretation and understand their relationship to different doctrinal positions.
Analyse central constitutional law concepts, structural features, and implications arising from the constitutional text.
Evaluate what is necessary for a constitution, assessing current deficiencies and strengths in the Commonwealth Constitution.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Independent research to assist in assessment preparation
Weekly readings will be required in preparation for lectures and tutorials

enrolment_rules.description: 20cp in LAW or LAWS units at 2000 level

assessments.description: Students will be assessed on their participation in tutorial debates, problem-solving, appropriate questioning, and understanding of the materials. This will require preparation before the tutorial â€“ ie completing the required reading and preparing thoughts/answers to the tutorial materials.
A time-limited assessment involving written responses to problems of Constitutional Law
Students will be required to engage in independent research to present a written response to a particular question of Constitutional Law.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde*
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
Session 1, Special circumstances, Other

* This unit offering is subject to a quota. Limited places are available. Please refer to the Faculty for further information.
data.description: This unit introduces students to fundamental principles of constitutional law and practice in Australia, including the basic structures of representative and responsible government, the structure and content of the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Australia and the relationship between the Commonwealth and the States. The unit places constitutional principles and doctrines in a wider context by exploring some of the questions that arise in relation to the framework for law and government in Australia. These include: federalism; democracy and citizenship; the rule of law; parliamentary sovereignty; and the relationships among the legislative, executive and judicial powers.
data.title: Constitutional Law
